Comments_List: Writing my senior thesis was incredibly beneficial for me as a student. I really believe I grew as a writer in ways I did not even know I could grow. After finishing my thesis, I feel like a significantly better, more concise writer.
All of the skills I have learned over the years have culminated into this one senior project. I learned how to manage research over the course of a year and how to organize a 50 page paper.
I improved my researching abilities, ability to analyze and interpret primary and secondary sources, and writing skills .

I learned how to conduct independent research, organize facts into illustrations and text boxes, design layouts, and integrate visual sources in a storyline. I really learned how to distill a vast amount of information into a readable format that combined text and visual sources.

This class gave me an excellent understanding of how to research and write a history paper. It also gave me the opertunity to learn about and research an area of study that I was interested in, and had not been taught in other classes. That being said, I had to conduct a lot of research independently, so I really learned how to reach out to different people and look for new sources I otherwise would not have thought of.
so many

I learned how to synthesize a lot of research and information into a clear and refined argument. I developed skills in interpreting primary sources and using secondary sources to contextualise and support my argument.
I think a class for this project wouldve been helpful, but I enjoyed working on my own. The skills I developed were very important.

I thought the senior essay project was a great way to finish my HSHM major at Yale. It allowed me to showcase the skills and knowledge I gained from my coursework, and it provided me the space to explore a new topic in depth. I don't think there were any weaknesses, per say, but I think the 50 page limit might be a bit restricting.

Strengths include how flexible and independent the project was; I definitely had control over my own project and had full creative flexibility over how it progressed. Weaknesses include the lack of formatting / examples of how to layout a title page, etc.--more of the technical details, the advising was great!

This course was great in the sense that I had the freedom to study areas of history that I wanted to study. However, I wish I had had a little bit of guidance in doing so. I had never written a paper of such magnatude before, so a little more help along the way would have been benificial. Overall though, it was a great class and I definitely got a lot out of it.
I would recommend group meetings for brainstorming and editing/keeping each other accountable

Strengths: Learn a tonne and writing became much stronger.

Weaknesses: The fairness of grading.
Doing a year-long senior thesis is A LOT of work, but at the end of the project, it is so fulfilling. I would 100% recommend that every HSHM student do the year-long senior thesis
Yes! Mostly because you have to do it.
I definitely recommend that HSHM students do the full year senior essay because it allows you to explore your topic in greater depth!
It's required nonetheless, but yes! You learn a lot.

I would absolutely recommend this class to another student. It is a feat culmination of for years of history classes, and a great opertunity to research topics that personally interest you. It is also a great way to look at new sources, and to make connections to prominent historians in your field of choice.
you have to take it to graduate
Yes. You will learn a lot about the researching and writing process. It also allows you to become an expert on a specific topic which is a great feeling.
